image.altText: David smiles, wearing a suit and tie, while Jessie in her picture also smiles, wearing a pink blouse.

props.synopsis: The vote count for the southern ACT electorate of Bean looks set to drag on for days, as the margin between the Labor incumbent and the independent challenger remains exceptionally close.

title.children: Counting for seat of Bean likely to drag on for days as AEC turns to postal votes

image.altText: The ACT law courts building at night.

props.synopsis: Dhiren Patel faces three charges of rape, among other offences relating to the alleged sexual assault of a 15-year-old girl. Magistrate Alexandra Burt told the court it was a strong prosecution case, partly because some of the incident was captured on CCTV.

title.children: 'Let's keep this a secret': Canberra cafe manager accused of raping 15yo

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with a small Bluey toy and colourful dollhouse.

props.synopsis: More than 1,100 children may be left without daycare as the fate of centres run by the Genius childcare empire remains in limbo.

title.children: Millions in debt mounting as Genius childcare provider searches for lifeline

image.altText: The earless dragon in an enclosure, standing on a rock.

props.synopsis: The Canberra grassland earless dragon is critically endangered and there are fears it could disappear forever. Environmentalists have expressed concerns over the construction of a new road that is impacting the species' habitat.

title.children: Plan to bring Australia's 'most endangered reptile species' back from the brink

image.altText: Three mothers with sombre looks outside the ACT Legislative Assembly.

props.synopsis: Bereaved Indigenous mothers turn their grief into strength as they welcome the ACT government's backing of a board of inquiry into the treatment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander detainees.

title.children: Bereaved mothers welcome inquiry into treatment of Indigenous detainees

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The man, who was 18 years old at the time, raped a 15-year-old he met in the pool at a tourist park and indecently assaulted another teenager.

title.children: Man jailed for sexual offences, including rape, against two teenagers

image.altText: Man holds a tissue to his face to blow his nose.

props.synopsis: As flu cases in Canberra continue to climb, health authorities are urging people to get vaccinated against influenza — but pharmacists are grappling with supply challenges.

title.children: Doctors bracing for 'whopper' flu season amid plea for vaccine take-up

image.altText: Peter Khalil on election campaign

props.synopsis: Meanwhile, the Liberal leadership battle is heating up, with Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor rumoured to have secured the support of NT senator Jacinta Price. Follow live.

title.children: Death threats, intimidation, violence: Labor MP labels Wills campaign 'disgusting'

image.altText: Senator McKim is mid sentence while standing in the Parliamentary Press Gallery.

props.synopsis: The Greens are expected to vote for a new leader late next week, after Adam Bandt's surprise loss in his seat of Melbourne left the minor party reeling.

title.children: McKim rules himself out of Greens leadership, urges 'unity' after Bandt loss

image.altText: Gemini AI logo is seen on a phone, held over a laptop

props.synopsis: Google will launch its Gemini AI chatbot for Australian children under 13 within months, the ABC can reveal. The announcement has prompted calls for the government to consider banning AI chatbots for children.

title.children: Google to target Aussie kids under 13 with its AI chatbot Gemini

image.altText: A close up photo of a phone with dating apps like Tinder, Grindr and Bumble on the screen.

props.synopsis: Police say groups of criminals have allegedly used fake profiles on dating platforms like Grindr to lure victims into being attacked and robbed.

title.children: Criminals used fake Grindr profiles to lure victims, Victoria Police say

image.altText: Glenn Wilson pictured with a dog

props.synopsis: A man jailed for his role in a dog fighting ring remains a member of multiple online groups that discuss the blood sport, even boasting that he has killed "more dogs than parvovirus".

title.children: Man linked to dog fighting ring boasted he 'killed more dogs than parvovirus'

image.altText: A gecko peeks out of the palm of someone's hands.

props.synopsis: New Caledonia's giant geckos are the latest sensation in the global pet trade. But conservationists warn their social media-fuelled popularity is putting the endangered species at risk.

title.children: The online gecko craze turning into a conservation nightmare

image.altText: Pakistani investigators collect pieces of a suspected Indian drone.

props.synopsis: Blasts have rung out across the Indian city of Jammu during what the government said was a Pakistani drone and missile attack on military stations around the Kashmir region on the second day of clashes between the nuclear-armed neighbours.

title.children: India says military stations were attacked by Pakistani drones and missiles

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson was visibly upset as she watched a recording of her daughter’s police interview in the aftermath of the deadly beef Wellington lunch at her home.

title.children: Accused killer Erin Patterson breaks down in court at daughter's testimony

image.altText: Cassius montage

props.synopsis: A memorial plaque for Cassius Turvey in his community of Midland, east of Perth, sits as an enduring reminder of the legacy he left behind: "gentle giant", "huggable teddy bear", and a "young leader".

title.children: Big in stature, with even bigger heart, Cassius's death shocked nation

image.altText: A dead penguin lays on a beach.

props.synopsis: The Department of Environment and Water said it was unclear at this stage if new penguin deaths on the Eyre Peninsula were linked to the ongoing algal bloom across South Australia.

title.children: Dead little penguins wash up on multiple Eyre Peninsula beaches

image.altText: High school students feed a sheep.

props.synopsis: Four years ago almost half of the students left this Brisbane high school without plans for work or study — financial literacy has turned that around.

title.children: 'Choice not chance': How financial literacy changed a high school

image.altText: GettyImages-2214118647 (1)

props.synopsis: Australian manager Ange Postecoglou leads Tottenham Hotspur to an all-England Europa League final with a powerful performance.

title.children: 'Couldn't be prouder': Ange's Spurs power into Europa League final

image.altText: Maro Itoje smiles

props.synopsis: England's Maro Itoje will captain the British and Irish Lions on their tour of Australia later this year, as Andy Farrell announced his touring squad.

title.children: Maro Itoje captains British and Irish Lions squad for Australia tour

image.altText: A tennis ball flies away from Jannik Sinner as he serves during a practice session.

props.synopsis: As Jannik Sinner prepares to return from his doping ban, there are still major questions to be answered about the process that led to such different outcomes for the world number one and Australia's Max Purcell.

title.children: As Sinner returns and Purcell stays banned, players want doping clarity

image.altText: Two election posters on a fence, one of Kate Hulett and the other for Josh Wilson.

props.synopsis: Sitting MP Josh Wilson's narrow win in the federal seat of Fremantle shows that, like the Liberals, Labor can be vulnerable to well-organised and well-funded independent candidates.

title.children: 'Status quo not good enough': Independent shakes up Fremantle electorate

image.altText: ADF and Port of Darwin workers rearm Australian, Canadian and US Warships at Port of Darwin 2024 Credit ADF

props.synopsis: Experts say the inclusion of new destinations for United States military cargo shipments, and their increasing lethality, marks a shift in US posturing in Australia and the Indo-Pacific region.

title.children: US to ship 'radioactive' materials to Australian ports in arms expansion

image.altText: Two women smile as one holds an infant to her chest

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr and Kristie Mewis welcome their first child, named Jagger Mewis-Kerr.

title.children: Sam Kerr announces birth of son with partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: Suited choir gesture with arms while standing on steps

props.synopsis: With an election, a papal conclave, and a whole lot of wild outfits on the Met Gala red carpet, it's been a big week in news. See how much you remember from the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Dutton's seat, the Met Gala and Trump

image.altText: A yellow and black helmeted honeyeater close up.

props.synopsis: There are fewer than 250 of Victoria's bird emblem left in the world, but a newly released colony is giving conservationists hope.

title.children: Critically endangered helmeted honeyeaters returned to the wild

image.altText: Lachie Schultz is helped off the ground by the trainers

props.synopsis: Collingwood's Lachie Schultz struggles to run off the ground after being collected in the head while trying to tackle as the Magpies run out with a 14-point win over the Dockers in Perth.

title.children: 'Rattling' scenes as Pies star collapses following sickening clash

image.altText: man shearing a sheep and the sheep looking to camera

props.synopsis: Australian wool production is forecast to reach its lowest level since the early 1900s, forcing skilled shearers to seek work interstate, overseas or leave the industry entirely.

title.children: Shearers struggle for work as wool production hits century low

image.altText: A man in a RAAF uniform

props.synopsis: For the first time since RAAF pilot Robert Crawford's arrest in October last year, it can be revealed exactly what he says happened the night his wife died.

title.children: 'Prayed and snuggled': Court documents reveal timeline before pilot allegedly murdered wife

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: Can US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent save the world from Donald Trump’s trade turmoil?

title.children: Swiss tariff crisis meeting between China and US may come to naught

image.altText: Two middle-aged women smile and stand tall in a street with a brick wall behind them, staring towards the camera.

props.synopsis: Faced with hatred due to their gender identity, Kooncha Brown and Chantell Martin struggled to find private rentals. Now they've secured safe housing thanks to special funding.

title.children: Housing secured for 'some of the most vulnerable in the community'

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and glasses wearing a red top, standing in front of a wall painted with a street art mural

props.synopsis: Sunshine Coast author Jessica Townsend is back with the much-anticipated fourth book in her bestselling Nevermoor series starring the magical Morrigan Crow.

title.children: The 'absurd' moment this Aussie author found out she was a NYT bestseller

image.altText: Wynyard Wildcatz 3

props.synopsis: Many of the team of cheerleading girls from a tiny town in Tasmania had never even been on a plane, let alone left their country, but a fundraising effort to see them sent to the US has paid off.

title.children: Tears, joy at Tassie girls' shock win at US cheerleading competition
